conclusion: Use properties of light refraction and total internal reflection.
Light is incident from the vertical interface at an angle θ = 60°.
Angle of incidence at the circular surface is such that the angle of refraction is 90° (critical angle for total internal reflection).
Using Snell's Law, n1 sin θ1 = n2 sin θ2, where θ2 = 90°, so n1 sin θ = 1.
Refractive index of glass is n = c/v, where v is the speed of light in the glass.
Since n = c/v, therefore n sin θ = 1 or c/v sin θ = 1.
In the right triangle formed by the light path, the angle of incidence is θ = 60°.
Distance OP is the x-coordinate of the point where the light hits the circular surface.
In the right triangle OPC, ∠COP = θ = 60°. Length of OC is R.
Using properties of the right triangle and angle θ = 60°, OP = R/2.
